original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānuloma (1), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The Triad-duka Paṭṭhāna Text🔽… the wholesome triad, the defilement column

original: 4.6. Kusalattika, Kilesagocchaka🔽4.6.1. Kusalattika, Kilesaduka
analyzed: kusalattika kilesagocchaka  kusalattika kilesaduka
translated: … the wholesome triad, the defilement duka

original: Akusalaṁ kilesaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo kileso dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: akusalam kilesam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ kilesaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome, a defilement, phenomenon as condition, an unwholesome, a defilement, phenomenon arises, a condition being a condition by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the root cause, one; in the object, one; … in the unobscured, one. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Kusalaṁ nokilesaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo nokileso dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  kusalam no kilesam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ no kilesaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the question section, in each case one.)🔽With a wholesome, not a defilement, phenomenon as condition, a wholesome, not a defilement, phenomenon arises, a condition being a condition by way of root condition … three.

original: Akusalaṁ nokilesaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo nokileso dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: akusalam no kilesam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ no kilesaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome, not a defilement, phenomenon as condition, an unwholesome, not a defilement, phenomenon arises, a condition being a condition by way of root condition … three.

original: Abyākataṁ nokilesaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato nokileso dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: abyākatam no kilesam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ no kilesaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an indeterminate, not a defilement, phenomenon as condition, an indeterminate, not a defilement, phenomenon arises, a condition being a condition by way of root condition.

original: Kusalaṁ nokilesañca abyākataṁ nokilesañca dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato nokileso dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam no kilesañca abyākatam no kilesañca dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ no kilesaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome, not a defilement, and an indeterminate, not a defilement, phenomenon as condition, an indeterminate, not a defilement, phenomenon arises, a condition being a condition by way of root condition.

original: Akusalaṁ nokilesañca abyākataṁ nokilesañca dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato nokileso dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: akusalam no kilesam ca abyākatam no kilesañca dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ no kilesaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With unwholesome and with indeterminate unadhesive …🔽(In brief as above.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā nava …pe… vipāke ekaṁ, avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā nava pe vipāke eka avigate nava
translated: With cause nine, with object three, with predominance nine … with nutriment one, with absence nine.

original: Kusalo nokileso dhammo kusalassa nokilesassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: kusalaḥ no kilesaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa no kilesassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A wholesome unadhesive element is a condition, as a cause condition, for a wholesome unadhesive element … three.

original: Abyākato nokileso dhammo abyākatassa nokilesassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākataḥ no kilesaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa no kilesassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An indeterminate unadhesive element is a condition, as a cause condition, for an indeterminate unadhesive element. (In brief as above.)

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā dasa …pe… avigate terasa.🔽4.6.2. Kusalattika, Saṅkilesikaduka
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā dasa pe avigate terasa  kusala ttika saṅkilesika duka
translated: With cause four, with object nine, with predominance ten … with absence thirteen.🔽… The wholesome triad, the adhesive dyad

original: Paccayacatukka🔽Kusalaṁ saṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo saṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: paccaya catukka  kusalam saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: The fourfold condition🔽A wholesome adhesive element is a condition, as a cause condition, for a wholesome adhesive element … three.🔽An unwholesome adhesive element is a condition, as a cause condition, for an unwholesome adhesive element … three.

original: Akusalaṁ saṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo saṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: akusalam saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome, corrupted state as condition, an unwholesome, corrupted state arises, a root-cause condition … three.

original: Abyākataṁ saṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato saṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: abyākatam saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome root cause, a wholesome root cause is a condition, as root-cause condition.🔽With an unwholesome root cause, an unwholesome root cause is a condition, as root-cause condition.🔽With an unwholesome root cause, a wholesome root cause is a condition, as root-cause condition.

original: Kusalaṁ saṅkilesikañca abyākataṁ saṅkilesikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato saṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam saṅkilesikam ca abyākatam saṅkilesikañca dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome root cause, a resultant root cause is a condition, as root-cause condition.🔽With an unwholesome root cause, a rootless root cause is a condition, as root-cause condition.

original: Akusalaṁ saṅkilesikañca abyākataṁ saṅkilesikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato saṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: akusalam saṅkilesikam ca abyākatam saṅkilesikañca dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome root cause, a wholesome root cause and a resultant root cause are conditions, as root-cause condition.🔽With an unwholesome root cause, a wholesome root cause and a rootless root cause are conditions, as root-cause condition.🔽With an unwholesome root cause, an unwholesome root cause and a resultant root cause are conditions, as root-cause condition.🔽With an unwholesome root cause, an unwholesome root cause and a rootless root cause are conditions, as root-cause condition.

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava
translated: With an unwholesome root cause, an unwholesome root cause, a resultant root cause, and a rootless root cause are conditions, as root-cause condition.🔽With a resultant root cause, a resultant root cause is a condition, as root-cause condition.

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Kusalo saṅkilesiko dhammo akusalassa saṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi  kusalaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa saṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: With a resultant root cause, a wholesome root cause is a condition, as root-cause condition.🔽With a resultant root cause, an unwholesome root cause is a condition, as root-cause condition.🔽With a resultant root cause, a wholesome root cause and a resultant root cause are conditions, as root-cause condition.🔽With a resultant root cause, a wholesome root cause and a rootless root cause are conditions, as root-cause condition.

original: Akusalo saṅkilesiko dhammo akusalassa saṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: akusalaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa saṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: With a resultant root cause, an unwholesome root cause and a resultant root cause are conditions, as root-cause condition.🔽With a resultant root cause, an unwholesome root cause and a rootless root cause are conditions, as root-cause condition.🔽With a resultant root cause, an unwholesome root cause, a wholesome root cause, and a resultant root cause are conditions, as root-cause condition.🔽With a resultant root cause, an unwholesome root cause, a wholesome root cause, and a rootless root cause are conditions, as root-cause condition.🔽With a resultant root cause, an unwholesome root cause, a wholesome root cause, a resultant root cause, and a root

original: Abyākato saṅkilesiko dhammo abyākatassa saṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākataḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa saṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome root is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the states of its own category that originate through root-cause.🔽(Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā satta, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate terasa.🔽Kusalaṁ asaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo asaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetuyā satta ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate terasa  kusalam asaṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: As root-cause condition, seven; as object condition, nine; as predominance condition, nine; … as non-disappearance condition, thirteen.🔽A profitable, unadulterated state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a profitable, unadulterated state.

original: Abyākataṁ asaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato asaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākatam asaṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: An unwholesome, unadulterated state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome, unadulterated state.🔽(Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… āsevane ekaṁ …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe āsevane ekam pe vipāke ekam pe avigate dve
translated: As root-cause condition, two; as object condition, two; … as repetition condition, one; … as kamma condition, one; … as nutriment condition, one; … as association condition, one; … as non-disappearance condition, two.

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)🔽Kusalo asaṅkilesiko dhammo kusalassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa  kusalaḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: (The section on the conascence condition is to be elaborated in the same way as the section on the conditionality of the dependent origination.)🔽A profitable, unadulterated state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a profitable, unadulterated state.🔽An unwholesome, unadulterated state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome, unadulterated state.

original: Abyākato asaṅkilesiko dhammo abyākatassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: abyākataḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome, unadulterated state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome, unadulterated state.

original: Abyākato asaṅkilesiko dhammo abyākatassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: abyākataḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: An unwholesome, corrupted state is related to an unwholesome, corrupted state as object condition.

original: paccayo. Abyākato asaṅkilesiko dhammo kusalassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ abyākataḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: An unwholesome, corrupted state is related to a wholesome, corrupted state as object condition.

original: paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā tīṇi, anantare dve …pe… upanissaye cattāri …pe… kamme tīṇi, vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā tīṇi anantare dve pe upanissaye cattāri pe kamme tīṇi vipāke ekam pe avigate dve saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on root cause there are two lines. In the section on object there are two lines. In the section on predominance there are three lines. In the section on proximity there are two lines. … In the section on decisive support there are four lines. … In the section on kamma there are three lines. In the section on result there is one line. … In the section on non-hindrance there are two lines. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The section consisting of questions should be elaborated as in the case of the wholesome triad.)

original: 4.6.3. Kusalattika, Saṅkiliṭṭhaduka
analyzed: kusalattika
translated: … The wholesome triad, the corrupted dyad

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Root cause and object

original: Akusalaṁ saṅkiliṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo saṅkiliṭṭho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: akusalam saṅkiliṭṭham dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: An unwholesome, corrupted state is related to an unwholesome, corrupted state as root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on root cause there is one line. In the section on object there is one line. … In the section on non-hindrance there is one line. (Abbreviated.)🔽(In the section on conascence, etc., and in the section consisting of questions, there is one line in each section.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the case of the born-together triad, etc., and in the case of the questions, in each case one.)🔽

original: Kusalaṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo asaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Kusalaṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato asaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam asaṅkiliṭṭham dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  kusalam asaṅkiliṭṭham dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome, unadulterated state as condition, a wholesome, unadulterated state arises, as root-cause condition.🔽With a wholesome, unadulterated state as condition, an unwholesome, unadulterated state arises, as root-cause condition.🔽With a wholesome, unadulterated state as condition, an unwholesome, unadulterated state arises, as root-cause condition.

original: Kusalaṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo asaṅkiliṭṭho ca abyākato asaṅkiliṭṭho🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam asaṅkiliṭṭham dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭho ca abyākataḥ asaṅkiliṭṭho  ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome, unadulterated state as condition, a wholesome, unadulterated state and an unwholesome, unadulterated state arise, as root-cause condition.

original: Abyākataṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato asaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: abyākatam asaṅkiliṭṭham dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome, unadulterated state as condition, an unwholesome, unadulterated state arises, as root-cause condition.🔽With an unwholesome, unadulterated state as condition, a wholesome, unadulterated state arises, as root-cause condition.🔽With an unwholesome, unadulterated state as condition, a wholesome, unadulterated state and an unwholesome, unadulterated state arise, as root-cause condition.

original: Kusalaṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhañca abyākataṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhañca dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato asaṅkiliṭṭho🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam asaṅkiliṭṭham ca abyākatam asaṅkiliṭṭham ca dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a neutral, unadulterated state as condition, a neutral, unadulterated state arises, as root-cause condition.🔽With a neutral, unadulterated state as condition, a wholesome, unadulterated state arises, as root-cause condition.

original: Kusalaṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo asaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam asaṅkiliṭṭham dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With a neutral, unadulterated state as condition, a wholesome, unadulterated state and a neutral, unadulterated state arise, as root-cause condition.🔽With a wholesome, unadulterated and a neutral, unadulterated state as condition, a neutral, unadulterated state arises, as root-cause condition.🔽With a wholesome, unadulterated state as condition, a wholesome, unadulterated state arises, as object condition.

original: Abyākataṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato asaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)🔽Kusalo asaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo kusalassa asaṅkiliṭṭhassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Abyākato asaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo abyākatassa asaṅkiliṭṭhassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Kusalo asaṅkiliṭṭho dhammo kusalassa asaṅkiliṭṭhassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … dve.
analyzed: abyākatam asaṅkiliṭṭham dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā pañca pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca  sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa  kusalaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa asaṅkiliṭṭhassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  abyākataḥ asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa asaṅkiliṭṭhassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  kusalaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa asaṅkiliṭṭhassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ dve

original: Akusalaṁ saṅkilesikañceva no ca kilesañca abyākataṁ saṅkilesikañceva no ca kilesañca
analyzed: akusalam saṅkilesikam ca iva no ca kilesam ca abyākatam saṅkilesikam ca iva no ca kilesam ca
translated: An unwholesome root is both corrupting and a defilement. An indeterminate root is corrupting but not a defilement.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato saṅkilesiko ceva no ca kileso dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ saṅkilesikaḥ ca iva no ca kilesaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A corrupting but not a defilement state is related to an indeterminate corrupting but not a defilement state as root-condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava
translated: In the nine roots, in the three objects, … in the one result, … in the nine non-hindrances, (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa
translated: (The section on the origination of the corruptions should be treated in the same way as the section on the origination of the hindrances.)

original: Kusalo saṅkilesiko ceva no ca kileso dhammo kusalassa saṅkilesikassa ceva no ca kilesassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: kusalaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ ca iva no ca kilesaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa saṅkilesikassa ca iva no ca kilesassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A wholesome root that is corrupting but not a defilement is related to a wholesome corrupting but not a defilement state as root-condition. … There are three.

original: Abyākato saṅkilesiko ceva no ca kileso dhammo abyākatassa saṅkilesikassa ceva no ca kilesassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākataḥ saṅkilesikaḥ ca iva no ca kilesaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa saṅkilesikassa ca iva no ca kilesassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An indeterminate corrupting but not a defilement state is related to an indeterminate corrupting but not a defilement state as root-condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate terasa.
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate terasa
translated: In the four roots, in the nine objects, in the nine predominances, … in the thirteen non-hindrances, …

original: 4.6.6. Kusalattika, Kilesasaṅkiliṭṭhaduka
translated: 4.6.6. The pair: skillful and corrupted by defilements

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Akusalaṁ kilesañceva saṅkiliṭṭhañca dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo kileso ceva saṅkiliṭṭho ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: akusalam kilesam ca iva saṅkiliṭṭhañca dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ kilesaḥ ca iva saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ ca dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With an unskillful and corrupted by defilements condition, there arises an unskillful and corrupted by defilements state, as a cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: With a cause condition there is one. With an object condition there is one. … With an absence condition there is one. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the question section, there is one in each triad.)

original: Akusalaṁ saṅkiliṭṭhañceva no ca kilesaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo saṅkiliṭṭho ceva no ca kileso dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: akusalam saṅkiliṭṭham ca iva no ca kilesam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ ca iva no ca kilesaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unskillful and corrupted but not a defilement condition, there arises an unskillful and corrupted but not a defilement state, as a cause condition.

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyāḥ ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With a cause condition there is one. … With an absence condition there is one. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the question section, there is one in each triad.)

original: 4.6.7. Kusalattika, Kilesakilesasampayuttaduka
translated: ... The pair: skillful and associated with defilements

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Akusalaṁ kilesañceva kilesasampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo kileso ceva kilesasampayutto ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: akusalam kilesañca iva kilesa sampayuttañca dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ kilesaḥ ca iva kilesa sampayuttaḥ ca dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unskillful and a defilement and associated with defilements condition, there arises an unskillful and a defilement and associated with defilements state, as a cause condition.

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyāḥ ekam pe avigate eka  sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: With root cause as condition … With object as condition … With non-disappearance as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽(In the section on origination, in the case of the questions on the pairs, triplets, etc., the method is the same as that for the unwholesome triad.)

original: Akusalaṁ kilesasampayuttañceva no ca kilesaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo kilesasampayutto ceva no ca kileso dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: akusalam kilesa sampayuttam ca iva no ca kilesam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ kilesa sampayuttaḥ ca iva no ca kilesaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a unwholesome, corrupt, but not a corruption, state as condition there arises a unwholesome, corrupt, but not a corruption, state. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyāḥ ekam pe avigate eka  sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: With root cause as condition … With object as condition … With non-disappearance as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽(In the section on origination, in the case of the questions on the pairs, triplets, etc., the method is the same as that for the unwholesome triad.)

original: 4.6.8. Kusalattika, Kilesavippayuttasaṅkilesikaduka
translated: … The Wholesome Triad, the Corrupted but Not a Corruption Dyad

original: Hetu🔽Kusalaṁ kilesavippayuttaṁ saṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo kilesavippayutto saṅkilesiko🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ kilesavippayuttaṁ saṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: hetu  kusalam kilesa vippayuttam saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ kilesa vippayuttaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā kusalam kilesa vippayuttam saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca
translated: Root Cause🔽With a wholesome, corrupted but not a corruption, state as condition there arises a wholesome, corrupted but not a corruption, state. With a wholesome, corrupted but not a corruption, state as condition there arises

original: abyākato kilesavippayutto saṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ kilesavippayuttaṁ
analyzed: abyākataḥ kilesa vippayuttaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā kusalam kilesa vippayutta
translated: an indeterminate, corrupted but not a corruption, state. With a wholesome, corrupted but not a corruption, state as condition there arises

original: saṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo kilesavippayutto saṅkilesiko ca abyākato kilesavippayutto🔽saṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Abyākataṁ kilesavippayuttaṁ saṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato kilesavippayutto saṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Kusalaṁ kilesavippayuttaṁ saṅkilesikañca abyākataṁ kilesavippayuttaṁ saṅkilesikañca
analyzed: saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ kilesa vippayutto saṅkilesikaḥ ca abyākataḥ kilesa vippayutto  saṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  abyākatam kilesa vippayuttam saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ kilesa vippayuttaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  kusalam kilesa vippayuttam saṅkilesikam ca abyākatam kilesa vippayuttam saṅkilesikam ca
translated: A wholesome, unentangled, corrupt thought is related to a corrupt, indeterminate, unentangled thought by way of root-condition.🔽Corrupt thoughts arise related to corrupt, indeterminate, unentangled thoughts by way of root-condition.🔽An indeterminate, unentangled, corrupt thought is related to an indeterminate, unentangled, corrupt thought by way of root-condition.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato kilesavippayutto saṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ kilesa vippayuttaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A wholesome, unentangled, corrupt thought and an indeterminate, unentangled, corrupt thought are related to an indeterminate, unentangled, corrupt thought by way of root-condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: Five by way of root-condition, two by way of object-condition … (and so on as in § 1 up to) … five by way of non-hindrance-condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa
translated: (The section on the origination of the corruptions in dependence on the corruptions should be treated in the same way as the section on the origination of the corruptions in dependence on the unentangled.)

original: Kusalo kilesavippayutto saṅkilesiko dhammo kusalassa kilesavippayuttassa saṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: kusalaḥ kilesa vippayuttaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa kilesa vippayuttassa saṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A profitable, defiled-neutral, corrupting state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a profitable, undefiled-neutral, corrupting state … for three …

original: Abyākato kilesavippayutto saṅkilesiko dhammo abyākatassa kilesavippayuttassa saṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākataḥ kilesa vippayuttaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa kilesa vippayuttassa saṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: An indeterminate, defiled-neutral, corrupting state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an indeterminate, defiled-neutral, corrupting state. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe cattāri, adhipatiyā cattāri …pe… avigate satta.
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe cattāri adhipatiyā cattāri pe avigate satta
translated: In the section on root-cause there are four, in the section on object there are four, in the section on predominance there are four … in the section on non-hindrance there are seven.🔽With respect to the profitable, undefiled-neutral, uncorrupting state, a profitable, undefiled-neutral, uncorrupting state arises conditioned by root-cause condition.

original: Kusalaṁ kilesavippayuttaṁ asaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo kilesavippayutto asaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Abyākataṁ kilesavippayuttaṁ asaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato kilesavippayutto asaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam kilesa vippayuttam asaṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ kilesa vippayuttaḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  abyākatam kilesa vippayuttam asaṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ kilesa vippayuttaḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With respect to the indeterminate, undefiled-neutral, uncorrupting state, an indeterminate, undefiled-neutral, uncorrupting state arises conditioned by root-cause condition.

original: Hetuyā dve …pe… āsevane vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe āsevane vipāke ekam pe avigate dve
translated: In the section on root-cause there are two … in the section on repetition there is one … in the section on kamma-result there is one … in the section on nutriment there is one … in the section on faculty there is one … in the section on jhāna there is one … in the section on path there is one … in the section on association there is one … in the section on dissociation there is one … in the section on presence there is one … in the section on absence there is one … in the section on non-disappearance there is one … in the section on condition there is one … in the section on non-deprivation there is one … in the section on non-hindrance there are two. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Kusalo kilesavippayutto asaṅkilesiko dhammo kusalassa kilesavippayuttassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kusalaḥ kilesa vippayuttaḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa kilesa vippayuttassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A wholesome, not-corrupted, uncorrupted state is a condition, as root-condition, for a wholesome, not-corrupted, uncorrupted state.

original: Abyākato kilesavippayutto asaṅkilesiko dhammo abyākatassa kilesavippayuttassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā tīṇi, anantare dve …pe… upanissaye cattāri …pe… kamme tīṇi, vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākataḥ kilesa vippayuttaḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa kilesa vippayuttassa asaṅkilesikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta  hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā tīṇi anantare dve pe upanissaye cattāri pe kamme tīṇi vipāke ekam pe avigate dve saṅkhitta  yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: An indeterminate, not-corrupted, uncorrupted state is a condition, as root-condition, for an indeterminate, not-corrupted, uncorrupted state. (Abbreviated.)

original: Kusalattikakilesagocchakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: kusalattika kilesa gocchakam
translated: As root, two; as object, two; as predominance, three; as proximity, two; … as support, four; … as prenascence, three; as postnascence, three; … as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, two; as dissociation, two; as presence, two; as absence, two; as disappearance, two; as non-disappearance, two; as kamma, three; as ripening, one; … as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, two; as dissociation, two; as presence, two; as absence, two; as disappearance, two; as non-disappearance, two; as kamma, three; as ripening, one; … as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, two; as dissociation, two; as presence, two; as absence, two; as disappearance, two; as non-disappearance, two; as kamma, three; as ripening, one; … as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, two; as dissociation, two; as presence, two; as absence, two; as disappearance, two; as non-disappearance, two; as kamma, three; as ripening, one; … as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, two; as dissociation, two; as presence, two; as absence, two; as disappearance, two; as non-disappearance, two; as kamma, three; as ripening, one; … as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, two; as dissociation, two; as
